title: A Beginner's Guide To Meditation And Its Benefits
summary: Meditation is the act of sitting down with the goal of focusing on one thing only – your breath. The goal is to silence the mind and get it off the constant thinking so you can relax and bring your stress levels down. There are different types of meditation, but they all have the same goal – to bring you peace and calmness inside. There’s no right or wrong way of doing it – you can sit on the floor, in a chair or even lie down if that’�s more comfortable for you.

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The idea of sitting still and focusing on your breathing might sound a bit too challenging at first, but meditation is actually much simpler than you might think. If you\u2019ve been struggling to find balance in your life and keep your stress levels under control, meditation is just what you need. As we go through this hectic world, our minds are constantly racing from one thought to another without even noticing. Most of us have a hard time dealing with the pressures of everyday life, which is why meditation can be such a great tool for clearing our mind and finding peace once again. It also helps reduce stress, lift our mood, increase self-awareness and make us more compassionate human beings. So if you\u2019re ready to adopt the practice of meditation in your life on a regular basis, read on \u2013 we\u2019ve got all the details you need!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

The important thing is to focus on your breathing and get your mind to \u201Cshut up\u201D."),mdx("h2",null,"How to meditate?"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Find a quiet spot to start off your meditation session. You can do this at home, in a park or even at your office if you have a quiet spot there."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Sit comfortably on a chair or the floor, or even lie down if that\u2019s more comfortable for you."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Close your eyes and focus on your breathing. Get your mind to \u201Cshut up\u201D so it doesn\u2019t start thinking about other things."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"If you\u2019re finding it hard to focus, use the sound of the waves or a ticking clock as a guide to help you."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Stay in meditation for at least 15 minutes \u2013 starting off slowly will help you get used to the practice.")),mdx("h2",null,"7 benefits of meditation"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It reduces stress levels \u2013 If you\u2019re feeling stressed out, meditation is a great way to help you relax and find a state of calmness."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It helps you sleep better \u2013 Meditation has also been shown to help with sleeping better. This happens due to the reduction in stress levels that come from meditating."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It reduces negative emotions \u2013 When you meditate on a regular basis, you become more aware of your negative emotions such as anger and guilt. Meditation helps you deal with those emotions so you don\u2019t act on them."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It helps you become more self-aware \u2013 Meditation gives you the chance to look inside yourself and truly understand who you are."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It improves your attention span \u2013 If you\u2019re someone who struggles with keeping your attention on one thing for a long time, meditation is what you need. It helps you focus on one thing for a longer period of time."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It makes you more compassionate \u2013 When you meditate on a regular basis, you become more compassionate towards other people.")),mdx("h2",null,"Key step: Turning up the volume on your senses"),mdx("p",null,"When you\u2019re in a meditative state, it\u2019s important to not only focus on your breathing but also on your senses. Start off by turning up the volume on your senses \u2013 what can you hear around you right now? What can you smell? What are the textures you feel when you touch something? If you were to see yourself as a camera, what would you focus on? While meditating, you have to make sure that you don\u2019t start thinking about your to-do list, work, or any other stressful thoughts. Instead, you have to focus on the present and be fully in the moment. This will help you take the edge off anything that\u2019s been weighing you down and help you truly relax."),mdx("h2",null,"4 more steps: Finding the spot where you\u2019re most comfortable"),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re starting to meditate for the first time, it\u2019s important to find a place where you feel comfortable and relaxed. If you\u2019re sitting on the floor, make sure that you\u2019re not in a position that\u2019s uncomfortable. If you\u2019re sitting in a chair, try to find one that\u2019s not too hard. If you\u2019re lying down, make sure you\u2019re not in a position that\u2019s going to make you uncomfortable. Meditation is an exercise in being present, so you want to make sure you feel as relaxed as possible. Once you\u2019re comfortable, take a few deep breaths and let go of any thoughts or feelings that are weighing you down."),mdx("h2",null,"3 more steps: Letting go of any discomfort or pain"),mdx("p",null,"As we\u2019ve said above, you want to find a place where you\u2019re comfortable and relaxed. That said, if you\u2019ve got pain from an injury, you might have to move to a more comfortable position. Sometimes, sitting in one position will cause you discomfort or even pain \u2013 and that\u2019s okay as long as you don\u2019t let it distract you from your meditation session. Once you\u2019ve found a place where you feel comfortable and relaxed, let go of any pain you might be feeling. Close your eyes, take a few deep breaths, and let the pain go. Let it go from your mind and your body. The goal of meditation is to completely remove yourself from your daily life and all the stress and anxiety that comes with it."),mdx("h2",null,"2 last steps: Finding your mantra and concluding"),mdx("p",null,"A mantra is a word or a phrase that helps you focus on what you want from meditation. When you\u2019re beginning to meditate, it\u2019s better to choose a simple word such as \u201Ccalm\u201D or \u201Crelax\u201D. As you go further into your meditation, you can move onto more complex words. As you reach the end of your meditation, take a few more deep breaths. Slowly open your eyes and get ready to face the rest of your day."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"A Beginner\u2019s Guide To Meditation And Its Benefits You don\u2019t have to be a monk, a yogi or a zen master to meditate. In fact, you don\u2019t even have to sit cross-legged on the floor to get the benefits of meditation. All you need to do is sit somewhere comfortable and focus on your breathing. Whether you\u2019re trying to calm down before an important meeting or trying to get a grip on your anxiety and stress levels, meditation is just what you need!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Choices When Eating Out
The Best Healthy Breakfast Recipes to Start Your Day

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`With so many people operating on tight schedules, the majority of us skip breakfast. If you find yourself falling into this category, you\u2019re not alone. In fact, skipping meals is one of the most common diet pitfalls. Skipping a meal or two can lead to an increase in your blood sugar and make it more difficult to lose weight.
Incorporating healthy breakfasts every day will help keep your metabolism running more efficiently and reduce cravings later on in the day. High-protein breakfasts are especially helpful if you\u2019re trying to lose weight or build muscle. Here are some great ideas for incorporating healthy breakfasts into your regular routine.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Food Choices When You're Hungry
How to Make Healthy Snacks More Exciting
How to Make Healthy Eating a Priority

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`You know that healthy eating is important and that you should make it a priority, but with so much going on in your life right now, it can feel like an impossible goal to achieve. Between work, school, volunteering, and friends, it can seem like there are not enough hours in the day to get everything done. Eating well often feels like yet another thing you need to add to your endless list of responsibilities and obligations.
But making great food choices doesn\u2019t have to take up a lot of time or feel like a chore. There are lots of simple things you can do every day that will help you make eating well a top priority. Even if your schedule seems packed, these small changes will help you get the nutrition your body needs without taking up too much of your time or energy.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Healthy Diet - And How It Can Improve Your Mood
10 Ways to Make a Workout Fun, Even If You Hate Working Out

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The unfortunate reality is that not everyone loves working out, and many people struggle to find activities they enjoy enough to continue on a regular basis. Some people hate it because of the physical discomfort, others because it\u2019s boring and feels like a chore, and for even more it\u2019s simply harder than they expected. . . Fortunately, there are plenty of ways to make your next workout fun again. Even if you hate exercising. Even if you feel unmotivated and drained every time you try. Working out doesn\u2019t have to be something you dread or look forward to only once in awhile. You just need the right strategies and techniques, which we\u2019ve outlined below as our top 10 ways to make a workout fun again, no matter how much you hate working out!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Eat Healthy on a Busy Schedule

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Eating healthy on a busy schedule is no easy task. It\u2019s not like we all have hours to cook and prep the perfect meal after a long day at school or work. So how are we supposed to eat right when there\u2019s barely time to even pick up fast food? Well, the answer isn\u2019t as hard as you might think\u2026 If you are ready to take control of your diet, then read on\u2026
If you feel like your life is always in hyper-speed and there\u2019s never enough hours in the day to get everything done, then you know exactly how these pressures can lead to unhealthy eating habits. But that doesn\u2019t have to be the case forever. Even with a busy schedule, it is totally possible for anyone to eat healthy meals regularly.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
